material.mattext: 5. Which JavaScript object is a combination of the content and interface elements that constitute the current Web page?
The document object
The navigator object
The image object
The window object
After a user has entered information into a text field, which property is used to retrieve the information?
The value property
The name property
The defaultValue property
The form property
Which JavaScript object allows the user to choose one or more items from a list box?
The select object
The checkbox object
The radio object
The textarea object
Which HTML5 form element produces an option button in a set of mutually exclusive option buttons?
radio
checkbox
button
select
Which choice best describes steps you can take to secure your browser and operating system from threats related to JavaScript?
Use the latest stable version of the software and the latest updates to best protect your operating system, browser and other applications.
Vendors and developers have verified and secured JavaScript, so developers can accept the fact that JavaScript does not pose threats to browsers or operating systems.
The browser is typically secured using anti-virus software, but the operating system cannot be protected this way.
The operating system is typically secured using pop-up blockers, but the browser cannot be protected this way.
Which of the following operates on single instances of custom objects rather than on all objects?
Methods
Functions
Properties
Arrays
Which technology enables you to place formatting instructions in an external text file to determine the look and feel for a Web page or site?
Cascading Style Sheets
HTML entities
The alt attribute
The browser-safe color palette
Which of the following can be considered a benefit of Cascading Style Sheets (CSS)?
One simple change to the style sheet will change all elements across the site.
The formatting instructions in the style sheet are not inherited throughout the document, providing flexibility.
Making changes to elements in the site will update the style sheet.
You can use CSS in lieu of HTML to develop Web pages.
What is a CSS selector?
Any element to which designated styles are applied
The value in a markup tag you want to change with a CSS style
The property in a markup tag to which designated styles are applied
A format instruction in a CSS file

Consider the following code from a CSS document:

body {color: teal; font: white;}

This code is an example of what?
A rule
A property
A selector
A value
In a style sheet, what must you use to separate multiple declarations for one selector within a rule?
A semicolon ( ; )
A colon ( : )
A comma ( , )
A slash ( / )
In a CSS document, within what must you enclose properties and values when you define a rule for a specified selector?
Curly braces ( { } )
Apostrophes ( ' ' )
Square brackets ( [ ] )
Quotation marks ( " " )
What happens when you place a CSS rule between the /* and */ characters?
The rule will be ignored.
The rule will override all other styles in the HTML document.
The rule will take precedence.
The rule will apply only to the default page in a Web site.
You use the <hr> tag to:
add a horizontal line to a Web page.
add alternative text that appears if a graphic fails to load.
add a non-breaking space to a Web page.
display a graphic image on a Web page.
By default, horizontal rules display:
with a 3-D shading effect.
centered on the page, indented from the left and right margins.
left-aligned on the page.
right-aligned on the page.
You use the <img> tag to:
display a graphical image on a Web page.
add alternative text that appears if an image fails to load.
add a horizontal line to a Web page.
add a non-breaking space to a Web page.
Which attributes are required for the <img> tag in HTML?
The src and alt attributes
The src and width attributes
The height and alt attributes
The width and height attributes
Which attribute should you use with the <img> tag to specify the text to display if a user has configured his or her browser not to display images?
The alt attribute
The style attribute
The src attribute
The text attribute
Generally, which Web image format should you use if you want the highest image quality?
Joint Photographic Experts Group (JPEG)
Graphics Interchange Format (GIF)
Portable Network Graphics (PNG)
Windows Bitmap (BMP)
Lossy compression is a compression technology:
in which the more an image is compressed, the more its quality is reduced.
in which the more an image is compressed, the more its quality is enhanced.
that has no effect on the quality of the image.
that is not copyrighted.
Which Web image format is best suited for line art, custom drawings and navigational images?
Graphics Interchange Format (GIF)
Joint Photographic Experts Group (JPEG)
Portable Network Graphics (PNG)
Windows Bitmap (BMP)
Which of the following can be considered a disadvantage of the Portable Network Graphics (PNG) format?
Older browsers do not render the PNG format.
The PNG format does not support transparency and interlacing.
The PNG format uses lossless compression.
The compression used in the PNG format is not copyrighted.
Which <img> tag attribute specifies alternative text to appear while a graphic is loading, or in place of the graphic in non-graphical browsers?
The alt attribute
The style attribute
The src attribute
The text attribute
Which of the following would be the best method to use for floating images to the left and right of text in HTML5 if you are developing sites with multiple pages?
External CSS classes
The inline CSS style attribute
The height attribute of the element
The width attribute of the element
What is the default value for aligning images relative to text using CSS?
bottom
top
left
middle
Why should you maintain an image's relative measurements if you resize it?
To avoid distorting the image
To alter the image's original dimensions
To maintain the image's height when you change its width
To maintain the image's width when you change its height

You can include non-keyboard characters in Web pages, such as © and ®, by entering a special HTML code for each character, called the escape sequence. With what characters must you start and end the escape sequence?
You must start the escape sequence with an ampersand ( & ) and end with a semicolon ( ; ).
You must start the escape sequence with a semicolon ( ; ) and end with an ampersand ( & ).
You must start the escape sequence with an ampersand ( & ) and end with a tilde ( ~ ).
You must start and end the escape sequence with quotation marks ( " " ).
The HTML code < and > are examples of:
non-keyboard characters.
left- and right-aligned images.
left- and right-aligned horizontal rules.
non-breaking spaces.
Which technique should you use to indent a paragraph or create additional spaces between words on an HTML page?
Insert non-breaking spaces.
Insert a character break.
Insert a line break.
Press the spacebar.
In RGB code:
the higher the numeric value representing a color, the lighter that color will be.
the higher the numeric value representing a color, the more transparent that color will be.
the lower the numeric value representing a color, the lighter that color will be.
the lower the numeric value representing a color, the less transparent that color will be.
What color does the mixture of red, green and blue light on a monitor screen produce?
White
Black
Violet
Brown
In hexadecimal code, the number 16 is represented as:
A.
F.
What color does the hexadecimal value #FFFFFF represent?
White
Black
Violet
Brown
What color does the hexadecimal value #000000 represent?
Black
Violet
White
Brown
What will occur if your HTML code asks for a color that the browser or operating system cannot support?
The computer will compensate by dithering.
The computer will compensate by imaging.
The computer will represent the color as gray.
The computer will represent the color as white.
The browser-safe color palette is a standard of 216 colors that:
will render consistently in any browser or with any operating system.
are defined for use in earlier versions of HTML but are deprecated in HTML5.
are defined for use in HTML5 but are not backward-compatible to earlier versions of HTML.
are not defined by RGB values or hexadecimal code.
Which property can you add to the body selector in an external CSS file to specify the color of the page background?
The background-color property
The background-image property
The color property
The font-family property
Which attribute of the anchor (<a>) element determines the color of unvisited hyperlinks?
a:link
a:visited
a:text
a:default
CSS allows you to change the size of text. Which of the following statements about the font-size property is true?
Headings (h1 through h6) should be used whenever possible instead of the font-size property.
The font-size property should be used whenever possible instead of headings (h1 through h6).
The default size of text for the font-size property is 10 pixels.
The font-size property is deprecated in HTML5.
CSS allows you to change the typeface of text. Which of the following statements about the font-family property is true?
If you list multiple fonts in the font-family property, the next font will attempt to render if the first font is not supported.
If you list multiple fonts in the font-family property, the text will not render if the first font is not supported.
If you list a single, multi-word font in the font-family property, you must enclose the font name within curly braces.
You can only list a single font in the font-family property.
What happens if you specify a font name in an external CSS file that a user's system does not support?
The font will display as a default font face.
The font you specified will be automatically added to the user's system.
The text to which the font is applied will not render.
The text to which the font is applied will appear as blue, underlined text.
Which of the following is true about the color combinations you use for your Web site?
Color combinations can convey the personality of the site by imposing tone and mood.
Once a color scheme is chosen, most sites use darker shades of chosen colors for background.
Using lighter shades of chosen colors for background detracts from the professional look of the site.
Color combinations that are appropriate for your country's culture are generally appropriate for all cultures.
Why should you use succinct wording on Web pages, especially the home page, when designing your site?
Because most users simply scan pages quickly looking for specific information or links to it
Because most users want to see all topics on each page for easy reference
Because you need to allow room on each page for as many navigational aids as possible
Because you need to allow room on each page for comments within the source code
HTML5 with CSS has introduced specific elements to structure Web pages. In which structure element should you include hypertext menus to access various pages of the Web site?
The <nav> structure element
The <header> structure element
The <article> structure element
The <aside> structure element
Which of the following is considered to be the preferred method of designing Web pages?
Implementing a liquid design layout using CSS
Implementing a fixed-width layout using CSS
Implementing an absolute-positioning layout using CSS
Implementing a multi-page layout using CSS
What happens when you place an image file in a subdirectory and neglect to reference the subdirectory in the <img> tag's src attribute?
The page will render without the image file, and a small box with an X will appear in its place.
The page containing the image file will not render.
The page will render with the image file because the src attribute automatically searches through the directory structure until the file is found.
The page will render with the image file because all image, style sheet and Web page files must be somewhere in the directory.
